alert.note: Alert for Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 16 at 3:36AM EST until January 16 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. The snow may mix with sleet late tonight and early Monday. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph will produce significant blowing and drifting snow late Monday and Monday night. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Oswego county. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 PM this evening to 1 AM EST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult with deep snow cover on roads and poor visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute Monday. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes early this morning.
info.instruction: Widespread accumulating snow will create dangerous travel conditions. Submit snow reports through our website or social media. This is a potentially dangerous situation to be outdoors. If you must be outside, be sure to cover all exposed skin. Frostbite can occur in 30 minutes or less with apparent temperatures of 15 below zero or colder.
